alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Gregg; Rusk; Smith (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 4:34PM CDT until March 31 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 500 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN SMITH...NORTHWESTERN RUSK...SOUTHWESTERN GREGG AND NORTHWESTERN CHEROKEE COUNTIES... At 433 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Liberty City to near Arp to near Whitehouse to Bullard to near Reese, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Longview, Kilgore, Whitehouse, Overton, Bullard, Troup, New London, Arp, Mount Selman, Liberty City, Joinerville, Mixon, Turnertown, Lake Palestine, New Chapel Hill, Cuney, Rolling Meadows, Teaselville, Concord and Laird Hill. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for northeastern Texas. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure.
